model

Class PayloadSequences

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.PayloadSequences

  • public class PayloadSequences
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of useful static methods and constants to be used by the encapsulation algorithms and the PayloadSegment.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte[] END_HEADER_SEQ
      The end header sequence can be used to put encapsulation metadata, as for example the payload file name, before the payload file bytes.
      static byte[] END_SEQ
      This sequence can be used to indicate where the encapsulated payload in a carrier file ends.
      static byte[] START_SEQ
      This sequence can be used to indicate where the encapsulated payload in a carrier file starts.

    • Field Detail

      • END_HEADER_SEQ

        public static final byte[] END_HEADER_SEQ
        The end header sequence can be used to put encapsulation metadata, as for example the payload file name, before the payload file bytes. It indicates where these encapsulation metadata ends.

      • END_SEQ

        public static final byte[] END_SEQ
        This sequence can be used to indicate where the encapsulated payload in a carrier file ends.

      • START_SEQ

        public static final byte[] START_SEQ
        This sequence can be used to indicate where the encapsulated payload in a carrier file starts.

        Returns:

      • skipSequence

        public static int skipSequence(int index,
               byte[] sequence)
        The trick here is that the index (of a byte array) is on the first byte of sequence. The new index will be on the last byte of the (start / end / etc) sequence, as this method is often called from within a for loop, so the index will be increased by the loop and point to the first byte after the sequence afterwards. If the method not called from within a for loop, the index has to be increased by 1 manually to get the first byte of the following content.
        Parameters:
        index - index of first byte of a byte sequence
        sequence - the byte sequence to be skipped
        Returns:
        index of last byte of a byte sequence
